results.title: Warriors and dancers
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Narjiic Day-Burns
results.brief_description:
Narjiic’s passion for music and dance began in Year 10 when he was asked to perform for NAIDOC Week. From there he joined various dance groups performing all over Victoria including his home town Echuca, finally enrolling at Swinburne. Today he blends a fusion of traditional dance with hip-hop as a way of expressing his thoughts and emotions. Dance has become a part of his life.
Music by Fonetik.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh

results.title: The Land is your mother
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Clive Atkinson
results.brief_description: Clive “Bidja” Atkinson reminisces about his childhood, firstly in the Goulburn River region and then later in Echuca. He speaks of his love for the land and the Murray River and of his respect for the Yorta Yorta culture that has been passed on to him by his family. Clive became the first Koorie in Victoria to obtain a qualification in graphic design but no matter where his travels will take him, Clive will always return to the land of his mother.
results.description: Clive “Bidja” Atkinson reminisces about his childhood, firstly in the Goulburn River region and then later in Echuca. He speaks of his love for the land and the Murray River and of his respect for the Yorta Yorta culture that has been passed on to him by his family. Clive became the first Koorie in Victoria to obtain a qualification in graphic design but no matter where his travels will take him, Clive will always return to the land of his mother.

results.title: Gungarri woman
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Linda Wordie
results.brief_description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.
results.description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.

results.title: Days of Echuca
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Barbara Day
results.brief_description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.
results.description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.

results.title: Recovering hope
results.brief_description:
‘Recovering Hope’ captures the personal stories of women who fled their homeland Vietnam for a new life in Australia. Sinking boats, pirates and transit camps were experiences for many as they made the dangerous journey.
This Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House, marks the 30th anniversary of the first wave of migration.

results.title: The Village green
results.brief_description:
Vietnamese poet Huong Trieu worked with ACMI to produce a visual treatment of her poetry about village life in Vietnam. This was part of a VicHealth funded initiative.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.
